experience: You and Ben "The Automator" both know Steven Aldrich, Dimitri Ponomareff, and 105 others
Ben "The Automator" can introduce you to 9 people at Early Warning®
Mike Owens is in Phoenix and looking for a new opportunity. He is an automation and software developer with over 15 years of experience in C,C++,Java and Python.

I'm thrilled to share with my network that today was my first day with OfferPad!  Thank you to everyone in my network who helped me in my search.  I feel so lucky to have such a great network of colleagues and friends who so generous with their time to help.
Looking for a Full Stack Developer with MEAN/MERN Experience. If you are interested, please reach out.
Looking for a Security DevOps Engineer. If you are interested, please reach out.
I'm interested in chatting with Security developers, secops guys and Security automation people. If you have an interest/Knowledge in any of these topics, please connect and send me a message.
Looking for Full Stack Developer and SecOPS candidates to join our growing team. Know anyone interested? Refer them to me, please! Comments below are certainly welcome.
- Experience with MERN, Python and PHP
- Experience in 2 or more of the following: MySQL, ElasticDB, MongoDB
- Familiarity with tooling creation (Python, Ruby, JS)
- Knowledge/experience with open source firewall related configurations and tools such as PfSense
- Knowledge of containers such as docker
- Knowledge of orchestration methods such as Kunernetes
- Ability to think outside the box
Looking for local candidates only right now please.
Non-recruiters please. I appreciate what you do, but want to exhaust my resources first.

recommendations: Vincent Koski
CyberDefense Engineer at Godaddy.com LLC
November 17, 2014, Vincent was senior to Ben "The Automator" but didn’t manage directly

I worked very closely with Ben at Godaddy.com.  We learned and developed procedures and troubleshooting methodologies for IPS/IDS software/appliances.  I worked on maintaining stability and performance of the systems,  and Ben worked to better leverage the technologies for custom protection from targeted and profiled attacks.   I worked closely with Ben as we deployed new versions of software and monitored performance to determine the cost of the signatures.  I'd be proud to work with Ben again in the future.

summary: I am not entertaining any employment opportunities at this time. Thank you for your interest though!———————I'm Ben. The InfoSec guy who loves automation and integrations. If it's challenging and near impossible, sign me up. I am the wildcard in IT being able to create solutions, pivot on a dime and figure my way out of even the most complex situations. I am very verbose and won't stand for minimal effort. However, please be advised that I am not a decision maker and will be unable to honor requests for product reviews.  If you would like to connect and be part of my professional network, please send a request. - I am a seasoned veteran of InfoSec and IT. - I enjoy challenging tasks such as creating, automating and perfecting technology and security solutions.- I am innovative and radical in my thoughts. - With multiple scripting languages, I can adapt to any environment and learn on my feet very quickly. - I strive to do things better and the right way when creating solutions.- I am eager to learn and always improving.
name: Ben "The Automator" C, TCSP
title: Automating security solutions and finding my way out of complex situations
